what: Load FedData and define a study area
title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Load FedData and magrittr library(FedData) library(magrittr) library(terra)  # Install mapview if necessary if (!require("mapview")) {   install.packages("mapview") }  library(mapview) mapviewOptions(   basemaps = c(),   homebutton = FALSE,   query.position = "topright",   query.digits = 2,   query.prefix = "",   legend.pos = "bottomright",   platform = "leaflet",   fgb = TRUE,   georaster = TRUE )  # Create a nice mapview template plot_map <-   function(x, ...) {     if (inherits(x, "SpatRaster")) {       x %<>%         as("Raster")     }      bounds <-       FedData::meve %>%       sf::st_bbox() %>%       as.list()      mapview::mapview(x, ...)@map %>%       leaflet::removeLayersControl() %>%       leaflet::addTiles(         urlTemplate = "https://basemap.nationalmap.gov/ArcGIS/rest/services/USGSShadedReliefOnly/MapServer/tile/{z}/{y}/{x}"       ) %>%       leaflet::addTiles(         urlTemplate = "https://tiles.stadiamaps.com/tiles/stamen_toner_lines/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"       ) %>%       leaflet::addTiles(         urlTemplate = "https://tiles.stadiamaps.com/tiles/stamen_toner_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"       ) %>%       # leaflet::addProviderTiles("Stamen.TonerLines") %>%       # leaflet::addProviderTiles("Stamen.TonerLabels") %>%       leaflet::addPolygons(         data = FedData::meve,         color = "black",         fill = FALSE,         options = list(pointerEvents = "none"),         highlightOptions = list(sendToBack = TRUE)       ) %>%       leaflet::fitBounds(         lng1 = bounds$xmin,         lng2 = bounds$xmax,         lat1 = bounds$ymin,         lat2 = bounds$ymax       )   }   # FedData comes loaded with the boundary of Mesa Verde National Park, for testing FedData::meve #> Geometry set for 1 feature  #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -108.5547 ymin: 37.15642 xmax: -108.3396 ymax: 37.35052 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84  plot_map(FedData::meve,   legend = FALSE )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the NED (USA ONLY) # Returns a raster NED <- get_ned(   template = FedData::meve,   label = "meve" )  plot_map(NED,   layer.name = "NED Elevation (m)",   maxpixels = terra::ncell(NED) )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the DAYMET (North America only) # Returns a raster DAYMET <- get_daymet(   template = FedData::meve,   label = "meve",   elements = c("prcp", "tmax"),   years = 1985 )  plot_map(DAYMET$tmax$`1985-10-23`,   layer.name = "TMAX on 23 Oct 1985 (Degrees C)",   maxpixels = terra::ncell(DAYMET$tmax) )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the daily GHCN data (GLOBAL) # Returns a list: the first element is the spatial locations of stations, # and the second is a list of the stations and their daily data GHCN.prcp <- get_ghcn_daily(   template = FedData::meve,   label = "meve",   elements = c("prcp") )  GHCN.prcp$spatial %>%   dplyr::mutate(label = paste0(ID, ": ", NAME)) %>%   plot_map(     label = "label",     layer.name = "GHCN_prcp",     legend = FALSE   )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Elements for which you require the same data # (i.e., minimum and maximum temperature for the same days) # can be standardized using standardize==T GHCN.temp <- get_ghcn_daily(   template = FedData::meve,   label = "meve",   elements = c("tmin", "tmax"),   years = 1980:1985,   standardize = TRUE )  GHCN.temp$spatial %>%   dplyr::mutate(label = paste0(ID, ": ", NAME)) %>%   plot_map(     label = "label",     layer.name = "GHCN_temp",     legend = FALSE   )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the NHD (USA ONLY) NHD <-   get_nhd(     template = FedData::meve,     label = "meve",     force.redo = TRUE   )  # FedData comes with a simple plotting function for NHD data plot_nhd(NHD, template = FedData::meve) # Or, do an interactive map NHD[purrr::map_lgl(NHD, ~ (nrow(.x) != 0))] %>%   plot_map() # You can also retrieve the Watershed Boundary Dataset WBD <-   get_wbd(     template = FedData::meve,     label = "meve"   )  plot_map(WBD,   zcol = "name",   legend = FALSE )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the NRCS SSURGO data (USA ONLY) SSURGO.MEVE <- get_ssurgo(   template = FedData::meve,   label = "meve" )  SSURGO.MEVE$spatial %>%   rmapshaper::ms_simplify() %>%   dplyr::left_join(     SSURGO.MEVE$tabular$mapunit %>%       dplyr::mutate(mukey = as.character(mukey)),     by = c("MUKEY" = "mukey")   ) %>%   dplyr::mutate(label = paste0(MUKEY, ": ", muname)) %>%   dplyr::select(-musym) %>%   plot_map(     zcol = "label",     legend = FALSE   )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Or, download by Soil Survey Area names SSURGO.areas <- get_ssurgo(   template = c("CO670"),   label = "CO670" )  SSURGO.areas$spatial %>%   rmapshaper::ms_simplify() %>%   dplyr::left_join(     SSURGO.areas$tabular$muaggatt %>%       dplyr::mutate(mukey = as.character(mukey)),     by = c("MUKEY" = "mukey")   ) %>%   dplyr::mutate(label = paste0(MUKEY, ": ", muname)) %>%   dplyr::select(-musym) %>%   plot_map(     zcol = "brockdepmin",     layer.name = "Minimum Bedrock Depth (cm)",     label = "label"   )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the ITRDB records # Buffer MEVE, because there aren't any chronologies in the Park ITRDB <-   get_itrdb(     template = FedData::meve %>%       sf::st_buffer(50000),     label = "meve",     measurement.type = "Ring Width",     chronology.type = "Standard"   ) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout #> all geometries  plot_map(ITRDB$metadata,   zcol = "SPECIES",   layer.name = "Species",   label = "NAME" ) %>%   leaflet::setView(     lat = sf::st_centroid(FedData::meve) %>%       sf::st_coordinates() %>%       as.numeric() %>%       magrittr::extract2(2),     lng = sf::st_centroid(FedData::meve) %>%       sf::st_coordinates() %>%       as.numeric() %>%       magrittr::extract2(1),     zoom = 9   )

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the NLCD (USA ONLY) # Returns a raster NLCD <- get_nlcd(   template = FedData::meve,   year = 2019,   label = "meve" )  plot(NLCD) # Also get the impervious or canopy datasets NLCD_impervious <-   get_nlcd(     template = FedData::meve,     year = 2019,     label = "meve_impervious",     dataset = "impervious"   )  plot(NLCD_impervious) NLCD_canopy <-   get_nlcd(     template = FedData::meve,     year = 2019,     label = "meve_canopy",     dataset = "canopy"   )  plot(NLCD_canopy)

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the NLCD (USA ONLY) # Returns a raster NLCD_ANNUAL <-   get_nlcd_annual(     template = FedData::meve,     label = "meve",     year = 2020,     product =       c(         "LndCov",         "LndChg",         "LndCnf",         "FctImp",         "ImpDsc",         "SpcChg"       )   )  # Returns a data.frame of all downloaded data NLCD_ANNUAL #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #> # Rowwise:  #>   product  year region collection version outfile             rast               #>   <ord>   <int> <ord>       <int>   <int> <glue>              <list>             #> 1 LndCov   2020 CU              1       0 /var/folders/rp/s0… <SpatRstr[,627,1]> #> 2 LndChg   2020 CU              1       0 /var/folders/rp/s0… <SpatRstr[,627,1]> #> 3 LndCnf   2020 CU              1       0 /var/folders/rp/s0… <SpatRstr[,627,1]> #> 4 FctImp   2020 CU              1       0 /var/folders/rp/s0… <SpatRstr[,627,1]> #> 5 ImpDsc   2020 CU              1       0 /var/folders/rp/s0… <SpatRstr[,627,1]> #> 6 SpcChg   2020 CU              1       0 /var/folders/rp/s0… <SpatRstr[,627,1]>  plot(NLCD_ANNUAL$rast[[1]])

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the NASS (USA ONLY) # Returns a raster NASS_CDL <- get_nass_cdl(   template = FedData::meve,   year = 2016,   label = "meve" )  plot(NASS_CDL)

title: Introduction to FedData
code: # Get the PAD-US data (USA ONLY) PADUS <- get_padus(   template = sf::st_buffer(FedData::meve, 1000),   label = "meve" )  plot_map(   PADUS$Manager_Name,   layer.name = "Unit Name",   zcol = "Unit_Nm" ) # Optionally, specify your unit names PADUS_meve_ute <- get_padus(   template = c("Mesa Verde National Park", "Ute Mountain Reservation"),   label = "meve_ute" )  plot_map(   PADUS_meve_ute$Manager_Name,   layer.name = "Unit Name",   zcol = "Unit_Nm" )

title: Scaffolds the common pattern of selecting a layer and filter a geometry from an ArcGIS feature service. — agol_filter
code: agol_filter(url, layer_name = NULL, geom, simplify = TRUE)

title: Scaffolds the common pattern of selecting a layer and filter a geometry from an ArcGIS feature service. — agol_filter
text: url url remote resource. Must length one. layer_name name(s) associated layer want retrieve. Can character vector. NULL (default), iterates layers. geom object class bbox, sfc sfg used filter query results based predicate function. simplify one layer exists, just return sf object data.frame, otherwise return list objects.

title: Scaffolds the common pattern of selecting a layer and filter a geometry from an ArcGIS feature service. — agol_filter

title: Scaffolds the common pattern of selecting a layer and filter a geometry from an ArcGIS feature service. — agol_filter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Get a single layer agol_filter(   url = "https://hydro.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/NHDPlus_HR/MapServer/",   layer_name = "WBDHU12",   geom = FedData::meve )  # Can be returned as a list agol_filter(   url = "https://hydro.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/NHDPlus_HR/MapServer/",   layer_name = "WBDHU12",   geom = FedData::meve,   simplify = FALSE )  # Get a list with all layers agol_filter(   url = "https://hydro.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/NHDPlus_HR/MapServer/",   geom = FedData::meve )  # Or include a vector of layer names # Note that missing layers are returned as `NULL` values agol_filter(   url = "https://hydro.nationalmap.gov/arcgis/rest/services/NHDPlus_HR/MapServer/",   layer_name = c(     "NHDPoint",     "NetworkNHDFlowline",     "NonNetworkNHDFlowline",     "NHDLine",     "NHDArea",     "NHDWaterbody"   ),   geom = FedData::meve ) } # }

what: Download the 1-km DAYMET daily weather dataset for a region as a netcdf. — download_daymet_thredds

code: download_daymet_thredds(bbox, element, year, region, tempo)

title: Download the 1-km DAYMET daily weather dataset for a region as a netcdf. — download_daymet_thredds
text: bbox bounding box WGS84 coordinates comma-separated character vector "xmin,ymin,xmax,ymax" element element extract. available elements : dayl = Duration daylight period seconds per day. calculation based period day sun hypothetical flat horizon. prcp = Daily total precipitation millimeters per day, sum forms converted water-equivalent. Precipitation occurrence given day may ascertained. srad = Incident shortwave radiation flux density watts per square meter, taken average daylight period day. NOTE: Daily total radiation (MJ/m2/day) can calculated follows: ((srad (W/m2) * dayl (s/day)) / l,000,000) swe = Snow water equivalent kilograms per square meter. amount water contained within snowpack. tmax = Daily maximum 2-meter air temperature degrees Celsius. tmin = Daily minimum 2-meter air temperature degrees Celsius. vp = Water vapor pressure pascals. Daily average partial pressure water vapor. year integer year extract. region name region. available regions : na = North America hi = Hawaii pr = Puerto Rico tempo frequency data. available tempos : day = Daily data mon = Monthly summary data ann = Annual summary data

title: Download the 1-km DAYMET daily weather dataset for a region as a netcdf. — download_daymet_thredds

title: Download and crop the 1-km DAYMET v4 daily weather dataset. — get_daymet
code: get_daymet(   template,   label,   elements = c("dayl", "prcp", "srad", "swe", "tmax", "tmin", "vp"),   years = 1980:(lubridate::year(Sys.time()) - 1),   region = "na",   tempo = "day",   extraction.dir = file.path(tempdir(), "FedData", "extractions", "daymet", label),   raster.options = c("COMPRESS=DEFLATE", "ZLEVEL=9", "INTERLEAVE=BAND"),   force.redo = FALSE,   progress = TRUE )

title: Download and crop the 1-km DAYMET v4 daily weather dataset. — get_daymet
text: template Simple Feature SpatRaster object serve template cropping. label character string naming study area. elements character vector elements extract. available elements : dayl = Duration daylight period seconds per day. calculation based period day sun hypothetical flat horizon. prcp = Daily total precipitation millimeters per day, sum forms converted water-equivalent. Precipitation occurrence given day may ascertained. srad = Incident shortwave radiation flux density watts per square meter, taken average daylight period day. NOTE: Daily total radiation (MJ/m2/day) can calculated follows: ((srad (W/m2) * dayl (s/day)) / l,000,000) swe = Snow water equivalent kilograms per square meter. amount water contained within snowpack. tmax = Daily maximum 2-meter air temperature degrees Celsius. tmin = Daily minimum 2-meter air temperature degrees Celsius. vp = Water vapor pressure pascals. Daily average partial pressure water vapor. years numeric vector years extract. region name region. available regions : na = North America hi = Hawaii pr = Puerto Rico tempo frequency data. available tempos : day = Daily data mon = Monthly summary data ann = Annual summary data extraction.dir character string indicating extracted cropped DEM put. Defaults temporary directory. raster.options vector GDAL options passed terra::writeRaster. force.redo extraction template label already exists extraction.dir, new one created? progress Draw progress bar downloading?

title: Download and crop the 1-km DAYMET v4 daily weather dataset. — get_daymet
text: named list SpatRasters weather data cropped extent template.

title: Download and crop the Global Historical Climate Network-Daily data. — get_ghcn_daily
code: get_ghcn_daily(   template = NULL,   label = NULL,   elements = NULL,   years = NULL,   raw.dir = file.path(tempdir(), "FedData", "raw", "ghcn"),   extraction.dir = file.path(tempdir(), "FedData", "extractions", "ned", label),   standardize = FALSE,   force.redo = FALSE )

title: Download and crop the Global Historical Climate Network-Daily data. — get_ghcn_daily
text: template Simple Feature SpatRaster object serve template cropping. Alternatively, character vector providing GHCN station IDs. missing, stations downloaded! label character string naming study area. elements character vector elements extract. five core elements : PRCP = Precipitation (tenths mm) SNOW = Snowfall (mm) SNWD = Snow depth (mm) TMAX = Maximum temperature (tenths degrees C) TMIN = Minimum temperature (tenths degrees C) elements : ACMC = Average cloudiness midnight midnight 30-second ceilometer data (percent) ACMH = Average cloudiness midnight midnight manual observations (percent) ACSC = Average cloudiness sunrise sunset 30-second ceilometer data (percent) ACSH = Average cloudiness sunrise sunset manual observations (percent) AWDR = Average daily wind direction (degrees) AWND = Average daily wind speed (tenths meters per second) DAEV = Number days included multiday evaporation total (MDEV) DAPR = Number days included multiday precipitation total (MDPR) DASF = Number days included multiday snowfall total (MDSF) DATN = Number days included multiday minimum temperature (MDTN) DATX = Number days included multiday maximum temperature (MDTX) DAWM = Number days included multiday wind movement (MDWM) DWPR = Number days non-zero precipitation included multiday precipitation total (MDPR) EVAP = Evaporation water evaporation pan (tenths mm) FMTM = Time fastest mile fastest 1-minute wind (hours minutes, .e., HHMM) FRGB = Base frozen ground layer (cm) FRGT = Top frozen ground layer (cm) FRTH = Thickness frozen ground layer (cm) GAHT = Difference river gauge height (cm) MDEV = Multiday evaporation total (tenths mm; use DAEV) MDPR = Multiday precipitation total (tenths mm; use DAPR DWPR, available) MDSF = Multiday snowfall total  MDTN = Multiday minimum temperature (tenths degrees C; use DATN) MDTX = Multiday maximum temperature (tenths degrees C; use DATX) MDWM = Multiday wind movement (km) MNPN = Daily minimum temperature water evaporation pan (tenths degrees C) MXPN = Daily maximum temperature water evaporation pan (tenths degrees C) PGTM = Peak gust time (hours minutes, .e., HHMM) PSUN = Daily percent possible sunshine (percent) SN*# = Minimum soil temperature (tenths degrees C) * corresponds code ground cover # corresponds code soil depth. Ground cover codes include following: 0 = unknown 1 = grass 2 = fallow 3 = bare ground 4 = brome grass 5 = sod 6 = straw multch 7 = grass muck 8 = bare muck Depth codes include following: 1 = 5 cm 2 = 10 cm 3 = 20 cm 4 = 50 cm 5 = 100 cm 6 = 150 cm 7 = 180 cm SX*# = Maximum soil temperature (tenths degrees C) * corresponds code ground cover # corresponds code soil depth. See SN*# ground cover depth codes.  TAVG = Average temperature (tenths degrees C) (Note TAVG source 'S' corresponds average period ending 2400 UTC rather local midnight) THIC = Thickness ice water (tenths mm) TOBS = Temperature time observation (tenths degrees C) TSUN = Daily total sunshine (minutes) WDF1 = Direction fastest 1-minute wind (degrees) WDF2 = Direction fastest 2-minute wind (degrees) WDF5 = Direction fastest 5-second wind (degrees) WDFG = Direction peak wind gust (degrees) WDFI = Direction highest instantaneous wind (degrees) WDFM = Fastest mile wind direction (degrees) WDMV = 24-hour wind movement (km) WESD = Water equivalent snow ground (tenths mm) WESF = Water equivalent snowfall (tenths mm) WSF1 = Fastest 1-minute wind speed (tenths meters per second) WSF2 = Fastest 2-minute wind speed (tenths meters per second) WSF5 = Fastest 5-second wind speed (tenths meters per second) WSFG = Peak gust wind speed (tenths meters per second) WSFI = Highest instantaneous wind speed (tenths meters per second) WSFM = Fastest mile wind speed (tenths meters per second) WT** = Weather Type ** one following values: 01 = Fog, ice fog, freezing fog (may include heavy fog) 02 = Heavy fog heaving freezing fog (always distinguished fog) 03 = Thunder 04 = Ice pellets, sleet, snow pellets, small hail  05 = Hail (may include small hail) 06 = Glaze rime  07 = Dust, volcanic ash, blowing dust, blowing sand, blowing obstruction 08 = Smoke haze  09 = Blowing drifting snow 10 = Tornado, waterspout, funnel cloud  11 = High damaging winds 12 = Blowing spray 13 = Mist 14 = Drizzle 15 = Freezing drizzle  16 = Rain (may include freezing rain, drizzle, freezing drizzle)  17 = Freezing rain  18 = Snow, snow pellets, snow grains, ice crystals 19 = Unknown source precipitation  21 = Ground fog  22 = Ice fog freezing fog WV** = Weather Vicinity ** one following values: 01 = Fog, ice fog, freezing fog (may include heavy fog) 03 = Thunder 07 = Ash, dust, sand, blowing obstruction 18 = Snow ice crystals 20 = Rain snow shower years numeric vector indicating years get. raw.dir character string indicating raw downloaded files put. directory created missing. Defaults './RAW/GHCN/'. extraction.dir character string indicating extracted cropped GHCN shapefiles put. directory created missing. Defaults './EXTRACTIONS/GHCN/'. standardize Select common year/month/day? Defaults FALSE. force.redo extraction template label already exists, new one created? Defaults FALSE.

title: Download and crop the Global Historical Climate Network-Daily data. — get_ghcn_daily
text: named list containing 'spatial' 'tabular' data.

title: Download and crop the Global Historical Climate Network-Daily data. — get_ghcn_daily
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get the daily GHCN data (GLOBAL) # Returns a list: the first element is the spatial locations of stations, # and the second is a list of the stations and their daily data GHCN.prcp <-   get_ghcn_daily(     template = FedData::meve,     label = "meve",     elements = c("prcp")   )  # Plot the VEP polygon plot(meve)  # Plot the spatial locations plot(GHCN.prcp$spatial$geometry, pch = 1, add = TRUE) legend("bottomleft", pch = 1, legend = "GHCN Precipitation Records")  # Elements for which you require the same data # (i.e., minimum and maximum temperature for the same days) # can be standardized using `standardize = TRUE` GHCN.temp <- get_ghcn_daily(   template = FedData::meve,   label = "meve",   elements = c("tmin", "tmax"),   standardize = TRUE )  # Plot the VEP polygon plot(meve)  # Plot the spatial locations plot(GHCN.temp$spatial$geometry, pch = 1, add = TRUE) legend("bottomleft", pch = 1, legend = "GHCN Temperature Records") } # }

code: get_itrdb(   template = NULL,   label = NULL,   recon.years = NULL,   calib.years = NULL,   species = NULL,   measurement.type = NULL,   chronology.type = NULL,   raw.dir = paste0(tempdir(), "/FedData/raw/itrdb"),   extraction.dir = ifelse(!is.null(label), paste0(tempdir(),     "/FedData/extractions/itrdb/", label, "/"), paste0(tempdir(),     "/FedData/extractions/itrdb")),   force.redo = FALSE )

title: Download the latest version of the ITRDB, and extract given parameters. — get_itrdb
text: template Simple Feature SpatRaster object serve template cropping. missing, available global chronologies returned. label character string naming study area. recon.years numeric vector years reconstructions needed; missing, union years available chronologies given. calib.years numeric vector required years—chronologies without years discarded; missing, available chronologies given. species character vector 4-letter tree species identifiers; missing, available chronologies given. measurement.type character vector measurement type identifiers. Options include: 'Total Ring Density' 'Earlywood Width' 'Earlywood Density' 'Latewood Width' 'Minimum Density' 'Ring Width' 'Latewood Density' 'Maximum Density' 'Latewood Percent' missing, available chronologies given. chronology.type character vector chronology type identifiers. Options include: 'ARSTND' 'Low Pass Filter' 'Residual' 'Standard' 'Re-Whitened Residual' 'Measurements ' missing, available chronologies given. raw.dir character string indicating raw downloaded files put. directory created missing. extraction.dir character string indicating extracted cropped ITRDB dataset put. directory created missing. force.redo extraction already exists, new one created? Defaults FALSE.

title: Download and crop the PAD-US Dataset. — get_padus
code: get_padus(   template,   label,   layer = c("Manager_Name"),   extraction.dir = file.path(tempdir(), "FedData", "extractions", "padus", label),   force.redo = FALSE )

title: Download and crop the PAD-US Dataset. — get_padus
text: template Simple Feature SpatRaster object serve template cropping. Optionally, vector unit names, e.g., c('Mesa Verde National Park','Ute Mountain Reservation') may provided. label character string naming study area. layer character vector containing one PAD-US Layers. default, Manager_Name layer downloaded. Protection_Status_by_GAP_Status_Code: PAD-US Protection Status GAP Status Code — Service representing measure management intent permanently protect biodiversity. GAP 1&2 areas primarily managed biodiversity, GAP 3 managed multiple uses including conservation extraction, GAP 4 known mandate biodiversity protection. GAP Status Codes 1-3 displayed, GAP 4 areas included displayed. Public_Access: PAD-US Public Access — Service representing general level public access permitted area - Open, Restricted (permit, seasonal), Closed. Public Access Unknown areas displayed. Use show general categories public access (however, areas locally reviewed). Fee_Managers: PAD-US Fee Managers — Service providing manager administrative agency names standardized nationally. Use categorization manager name, detailed federal managers generic state/local/managers. available layer includes fee simple parcels Fee feature class plus DOD Tribal areas Proclamation feature class. Manager_Name: PAD-US Manager Name — Service representing fine level manager administrative agency name standardized Nation (USFS, BLM, State Fish Wildlife, State Parks Rec, City, NGO, etc). map based PAD-US Combined Proclamation, Marine, Fee, Designation, Easement feature class. DOD Tribal areas shown 50% transparency. Use categorization manager name, detailed federal managers generic state/local/managers. Manager_Type: PAD-US Manager Type — Service representing coarse level land manager description "Agency Type" Domain, "Manager Type" Field (example, Federal, Tribal, State, Local Gov, Private). Use broad categorization manager levels, general depictions manages areas. Federal_Fee_Managers_Authoritative: PAD-US Federal Fee Managers Authoritative — Service describing authoritative fee data federal managers administrative agencies name. U.S. Department Defense Tribal areas shown Proclamation feature class. Use depict authoritative fee data individual federal management agencies (state, local private lands). service include designations often overlap state, private inholdings. U.S. Department Defense internal land ownership represented implied Federal. See Federal Management Agencies service combined view fee ownership, designations, easements. Federal_Management_Agencies: PAD-US Federal Management Agencies — Service providing Federal managers administrative agencies name. Use depict individual federal management agencies (state, local private lands). map based Combined Proclamation, Marine, Fee, Designation, Easement feature class. Protection_Mechanism_Category: PAD-US Protection Mechanism Category — Service representing protection mechanism category including fee simple, internal management designations, easements, leases agreements, Marine Areas. Use show categories land tenure protected areas, including marine areas. Proclamation_and_Other_Planning_Boundaries: PAD-US Proclamation Planning Boundaries — Service representing boundaries provide additional context. Administrative agency name standardized nation (DOD, FWS, NPS, USFS, Tribal). Boundaries shown outline , proclamation data depict actual ownership management. Use show outline agency proclamation, approved acquisition planning boundaries internal ownership depicted. extraction.dir character string indicating extracted cropped PAD-US data put. force.redo extraction template label already exists, new one created?

title: FedData 4.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-16 Updated getting started article include degree symbol Daymet graph, caused compilation errors Windows. Fixes Issue #106. Updated get_nlcd() include 2021 NLCD default, response Issue #105. Updated outdated package description Bumped GDAL version req >= 3.1.0 accommodate storing spatial vectors FlatGeoBufs Added arcgislayers dependency retired self-written esri functions. Closes Issue #109.

title: FedData 4.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-03 Updated README moved examples article Added PAD-US dataset response Issue #100. Updated get_nlcd() fix bug Issue #101 tree canopy data, whose URL changed. Updated get_ghcn_daily() respond slightly different file formatting https server Issue #99. Removed dependencies sp raster. functions now return either sf terra objects.

title: FedData 3.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-25 Updated get_ghcn_daily() related functions use https addresses instead legacy ftp server Issue #99. Updated get_nhd() gracefully handle situations point data (NHD data) available within area interest, using solution offered Issue #98. Updated get_nhd() handle strange geometries present NHD Issue #98.

title: FedData 3.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-10 Updated get_nhd() correctly access extraction.dir already exists Issue #95. get_nhd() get_ned() now use file.path() constructing file outputs. Updated get_daymet() use terra writing raster data, response Issue #96. functions FedData now use terra writing. Cleaned documentation.

title: FedData 3.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-26 Removed rgdal dependency throughout instead require raster >= 3.6.3. Switched back using Web Coverave Service NLCD, now providing data native CRS.

title: FedData 3.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-28 Updated get_nlcd() read CRS data correctly Issue #91 requiring rgdal installed. Changed Daymet tempo codes Issue #92

title: FedData 3.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-11 get_*() functions now return sf raster objects. Changed SDA_query() soils_query() avoid namespace masking SoilDB. Added get_nass_cdl() retrieve NASS Cropland Data Layer Updated get_daymet() pull ORNL WCS, fixed bug Issue #49 Fixed issue soils_query() returning first SSURGO study area (Issue #51) Fixed issue date parsing USA-specific leveraging lubridate::parse_date_time (Issue #61) get_ssurgo() now saves GeoPackage file format get_nhd() now access ESRI web services. Users can optionally get data NHDPlus. get_nlcd() now provides data native CRS (CONUS Albers), rather web-mercator (Issue #77) pulling self-hosted Cloud-Optimized GeoTiffs. Issue #88 identified issue GDAL versions prior GDAL 3 reading COGs using vsicurl functionality GDAL. Accordingly, FedData3 requires GDAL >= 3.0.0. Added Mesa Verde National Park exemplar region, removed use paleocar package. get_ned() now pulls USGS NED Cloud-Optimized GeoTiffs available https://prd-tnm.s3.amazonaws.com/index.html?prefix=StagedProducts/Elevation/.

title: FedData 2.5.7
text: CRAN release: 2019-04-22 Removing many internet resource tests CRAN, satisfy: ‘Packages use Internet resources fail gracefully informative message resource available (give check warning error).’

title: FedData 2.5.6
text: CRAN release: 2019-01-11 Built-access Soils Data Analysis query service remove dependency soilDB package.

title: FedData 2.5.5
text: CRAN release: 2018-08-09 Fixed issue (#41) occurs mosaicking NLCD tiles cropped. aren’t cropped, NLCD data never read memory, temporary file raster created gets destroyed. Solution: Force NLCD data memory prior mosaicking. Added (non-CRAN) test issue #41

title: FedData 2.5.4
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-05 Fixed issue downloading NED tiles.

title: FedData 2.5.3
text: CRAN release: 2018-05-21 Added httr package imports.

title: FedData 2.5.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-12 Updated NHD HUC4 copy stored Github. Fixed bug ITRDB caused chronologies read.

title: FedData 2.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-01-24 Switch laze-loading data. Updated NHD paths new National Map directory structure.

title: FedData 2.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-12-15 Added functions National Land Cover Database.

title: FedData 2.4.7
text: CRAN release: 2017-11-20 SSURGO fixed test supplying unavailable survey area now returns NULL instead error. SSURGO zip directory encoding changes late October 2017 forced changes FedData:::get_ssurgo_study_area function. Fixed issue NHD template wouldn’t load added jpeg preview directory.

title: FedData 2.4.6
text: CRAN release: 2017-08-18 DAYMET functions now operate parallel. breaking download functions. Final update version 2 FedData. Accepted ROpenSci! Migrating ROpenSci organization GitHub.

title: FedData 2.4.3
text: writeOGR SSURGO NHD failing Windows extraction.dir included trailing slash. Paths now normalized remove trailing slash.

title: FedData 2.4.2
text: Updated get_ned function provide useful errors warnings downloads unsuccessful.

title: FedData 2.4.1
text: Added pkgdown site. SSURGO functions (e.g., get_ssurgo) now doesn’t bomb large (> 1 billion sq meter) requests. Now, area interest broken smaller chunks build download list.

title: FedData 2.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-01-20 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Updated DAYMET functions fix bug downloaded one tile time. Linted code.
